author: Staff report
title: Stone helps Jr. Blues gain split at Topeka
text: Stone helps Jr. Blues gain split at Topeka Comment Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 10:41 AM By Staff report Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 10:41 AM TOPEKA, Kansas -- Trevor Stone scored two of the Springfield Junior Blues' three power-play goals in the third period Saturday night as they defeated the Topeka RoadRunners 4-1 in a North American Hockey League game. The win gave Springfield a split of the two-game road series. The Junior Blues (7-3-1) are tied for third place with Janesville in the NAHL Midwest Division. All four of Springfield's goals came on the power play Saturday. The Junior Blues were 4-for-5 on power-play opportunities. They held a 1-0 lead over Topeka after two periods, with Petr Kuznetsov's power-play goal in the first period giving Springfield the lead. Jeff Skinner and Joey Lupo assisted on Kuznetsov's goal. After a scoreless second period, Stone scored on assists from Anthony Scarsella and Kyle Meeh at 1 minute 8 seconds into the third period. Just over a minute later, it was Stone again on assists from Brady Tomlak and goaltender Niko Della Maggiore. Matt Long later made it 4-0 Springfield on assists from Tomlak and Stone. Topeka's Matt Jennings scored a power-play goal at 9:40 into the third period to break Della Maggiore's shutout. The RoadRunners were 1-for-6 on the power play and were outshot 29-28. The Junior Blues have a two-game home series against Janesville on Friday at Saturday at the Nelson Center. Both games begin at 7:05 p.m. By Staff report
